page.title: 03Cannock Forest.
page.content: We visited the Forestry Commission Office to interview the Forestry Manager who told us about Cannock Forest. The main trees grown are Corsican Pines which are best suited to the poor soil and local weather. The ground is prepared and the seedlings are planted nearly two metres apart. After about twenty years, some of the trees are cut down to give the others more light and room. Every five years, more are removed, and when the trees are about sixty years old, the whole plantation is felled. Other trees grown are pines, spruces, and silver firs and some are sold for Christmas trees. The wood is nearly all used locally for fencing posts, fencing panels and garden sheds.
